fiscal drag.translation[0].definitions[0: when rising incomes mean that the government receives increasing amounts of tax, as people move up into higher TAX BRACKETs (=levels of income with a particular tax rate). Taxes have to be adjusted to take account of this, if it is not to have an effect on the economy as a whole
If we do not cut taxes, the normal process of fiscal drag means that the tax burden rises over time.
